title: How to Make Chocolate Covered Frozen Bananas

steps.headline: Chop nuts and get out your toppings; set them aside.
Peel your bananas.
steps.description:
You can chop the bananas in half or leave them whole. Put them on a stick (insert the stick through the bottom). {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Melt chocolate in a microwave, or in an oven on a low temperature (remember, keep the chocolate plain) Make sure you do not leave it in too long.
Dip half or all of banana in melted chocolate.
steps.description: Try to make it look smooth.

steps.headline: Roll the banana in any toppings of your liking.
Set on wax paper and place them in freezer.
Leave it in the freezer until frozen (about 20-30 minutes).
Finished!
steps.description: Enjoy and try to eat before the banana unfreezes.

text:
Chop nuts and get out your toppings; set them aside. Peel your bananas. You can chop the bananas in half or leave them whole. Put them on a stick (insert the stick through the bottom). {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Chocolate-Covered-Frozen-Bananas-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Melt chocolate in a microwave, or in an oven on a low temperature (remember, keep the chocolate plain) Make sure you do not leave it in too long. Dip half or all of banana in melted chocolate. Try to make it look smooth. Roll the banana in any toppings of your liking. Set on wax paper and place them in freezer. Leave it in the freezer until frozen (about 20-30 minutes). Finished! Enjoy and try to eat before the banana unfreezes.
